title: ion-fab-button
body: Floating Action Buttons (FABs) represent the primary action in an application. By default, they have a circular shape. When pressed, the button may open more related actions. As the name suggests, FABs generally float over the content in a fixed position. This is not achieved exclusively by using an
. They need to be wrapped with an
component in order to be fixed over the content.
If the FAB button is not wrapped with
, it will scroll with the content. FAB buttons have a default size, a mini size and can accept different colors:

angular: <!-- Fixed Floating Action Button that does not scroll with the content -->
<!-- Default Floating Action Button that scrolls with the content.-->
javascript: <!-- Fixed Floating Action Button that does not scroll with the content -->
<!-- Default Floating Action Button that scrolls with the content.-->
react: /*-- Fixed Floating Action Button that does not scroll with the content --*/
/*-- Default Floating Action Button that scrolls with the content.--*/
stencil: /* Fixed Floating Action Button that does not scroll with the content */
/* Default Floating Action Button that scrolls with the content */
vue: <!-- Fixed Floating Action Button that does not scroll with the content -->
<!-- Default Floating Action Button that scrolls with the content.-->

props.name: activated
props.docs: If true, the fab button will be show a close icon.

props.name: color
props.docs: The color to use from your application's color palette. Default options are: "primary", "secondary", "tertiary", "success", "warning", "danger", "light", "medium", and "dark". For more information on colors, see theming.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If true, the user cannot interact with the fab button.

props.name: download
props.docs: This attribute instructs browsers to download a URL instead of navigating to it, so the user will be prompted to save it as a local file. If the attribute has a value, it is used as the pre-filled file name in the Save prompt (the user can still change the file name if they want).

props.name: href
props.docs: Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the hyperlink points to. If this property is set, an anchor tag will be rendered.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: rel
props.docs: Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object. The value is a space-separated list of link types.

props.name: routerDirection
props.docs: When using a router, it specifies the transition direction when navigating to another page using href.

props.name: show
props.docs: If true, the fab button will show when in a fab-list.

props.name: size
props.docs: The size of the button. Set this to small in order to have a mini fab.

props.name: target
props.docs: Specifies where to display the linked URL. Only applies when an href is provided. Special keywords: "_blank", "_self", "_parent", "_top".

props.name: translucent
props.docs: If true, the fab button will be translucent. Only applies when the mode is "ios" and the device supports backdrop-filter.

docs: Floating Action Buttons (FABs) represent the primary action in an application. By default, they have a circular shape. When pressed, the button may open more related actions. As the name suggests, FABs generally float over the content in a fixed position. This is not achieved exclusively by using an `
`. They need to be wrapped with an `

` component in order to be fixed over the content.

If the FAB button is not wrapped with `
`, it will scroll with the content. FAB buttons have a default size, a mini size and can accept different colors:

docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.
docsTags.name: virtualProp

events.docs: Emitted when the button loses focus.
Emitted when the button has focus.

styles.name: --background
styles.docs: Background of the button

styles.name: --background-activated
styles.docs: Background of the button when pressed. Note: setting this will interfere with the Material Design ripple.

styles.name: --background-activated-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the button background when pressed

styles.name: --background-focused
styles.docs: Background of the button when focused with the tab key

styles.name: --background-focused-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the button background when focused with the tab key

styles.name: --background-hover
styles.docs: Background of the button on hover

styles.name: --background-hover-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the button background on hover

styles.name: --border-color
styles.docs: Border color of the button

styles.name: --border-radius
styles.docs: Border radius of the button

styles.name: --border-style
styles.docs: Border style of the button

styles.name: --border-width
styles.docs: Border width of the button

styles.name: --box-shadow
styles.docs: Box shadow of the button

styles.name: --color
styles.docs: Text color of the button

styles.name: --color-activated
styles.docs: Text color of the button when pressed

styles.name: --color-focused
styles.docs: Text color of the button when focused with the tab key

styles.name: --color-hover
styles.docs: Text color of the button on hover

styles.name: --padding-bottom
styles.docs: Bottom padding of the button

styles.name: --padding-end
styles.docs: Right padding if direction is left-to-right, and left padding if direction is right-to-left of the button

styles.name: --padding-start
styles.docs: Left padding if direction is left-to-right, and right padding if direction is right-to-left of the button

styles.name: --padding-top
styles.docs: Top padding of the button

styles.name: --ripple-color
styles.docs: Color of the button ripple effect

styles.name: --transition
styles.docs: Transition of the button
